10.	 (a)	 a studentʼs attempt to answer the question
‟prove by contradiction that if n3 is even, then n is even”
	
	
is shown below. line 5 of the proof is missing.
assume that there exists a number n such that n3 is even, but n is odd.
if n is odd then  n = 2 p + 1  where  p ∈ 
	
so  n3	= (2 p + 1)3
	
	
= 8 p3 + 12 p2 + 6 p + 1
	
	
= 
this contradicts our initial assumption, so if n3 is even, then n is even.
	
	
complete this proof by filling in line 5.
